content.question: In lines 17-18 (“My heart . . . high”), the repeated references to the speaker’s “head” have the main effect of

choices.label: announcing the resolution of a paradox troubling the speaker
introducing a new concern that further distresses the speaker
suggesting the underlying inconsistency of the speaker’s thoughts
signaling a potential shift in the speaker’s perspective

content.answer: signaling a potential shift in the speaker’s perspective

skill.text: Skill 4.C: Identify and describe details, diction, or syntax in a text that reveal a narrator's or speaker's perspective.
